abstract: Medtronic said that it had paid nearly $800,000 to Dr. Timothy R. Kuklo, a former military surgeon who has been accused of falsifying a medical journal study involving one of the company’s products.
snippet: Medtronic said that it had paid nearly $800,000 to Dr. Timothy R. Kuklo, a former military surgeon who has been accused of falsifying a medical journal study involving one of the company’s products.
lead_paragraph: Medtronic said on Wednesday that it had paid nearly $800,000 over an eight-year period to a former military surgeon who has been accused by the Army of falsifying a medical journal study involving one of the company’s products.

headline.main: $788,000 Paid to Doctor Accused of Faking Study
headline.print_headline: $788,000 Paid to Surgeon Accused of Falsifying Study
